definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]

sentences.english: He'd had a chequered past but was now determined to be successful.
sentences.chinese: 他过去饱经沧桑，但现在决心要干一番成就。

sentences.english: If that was so, he had really been around.
sentences.chinese: 如果确实是那样，那他倒可真算是饱经沧桑的了。

sentences.english: The past sufferings of war and turmoil have taught the Asian people the value of peace.
sentences.chinese: 饱经沧桑的亚洲人民深知和平之可贵。

sentences.english: She has experienced the vicissitudes of life.
In the course of my long life I've known many changes.
sentences.chinese: 我在漫长的一生中饱经沧桑。

sentences.english: Is it any mystery that he hardened his heart, that he raised the emotional ramparts?
sentences.chinese: 这是否很神秘，因为他的心那样饱经沧桑？

definition: weather-beaten/having experienced the hardships of life
to have been through the hardships of life/to have been through the mill
great changes/ups and downs/vicissitudes/abbr. of 滄海桑田|沧海桑田[cang1 hai3 sang1 tian2]
a sense of having been through good times and bad/a weathered and worn look
one's late days/to have one foot in the grave
to have experienced a lot of/to have been through
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
